front.title: Sieve Extension: Copying Without Side Effects

abstract.t: The sieve scripting language allows users to control handling and disposal of their incoming e-mail. By default, an e-mail message that is processed by a sieve script is saved in the owner's "inbox". Actions such as "fileinto" and "redirect" cancel this default behavior. This document defines a new keyword parameter, ":copy", to be used with the sieve "fileinto" and "redirect" actions. Adding ":copy" to an action suppresses cancellation of the default "inbox" save. It allows users to add commands to an existing script without changing the meaning of the rest of the script.
